tool.name: mothra
tool.description: Mothra analyzes images of lepidopterans — mainly butterflies and moths — and measures their wing lengths. Using binarization techniques and calculating the resolution of ruler ticks, we read in images of lepidopterans and output the millimeter lengths of their wings.
tool.help:
usage: pipeline.py [-h] [-p] [-pp] [-i INPUT] [-o OUTPUT_FOLDER] [-s STAGE] [-ar] [-dpi DPI] [-csv PATH_CSV] [--cache]
This is mothra, a software to automate different measurements on images of Lepidopterae.
options: -h, --help show this help message and exit -p, --plot If entered images are plotted to the output folder -pp, --detailed_plot If entered detailed images are plotted to the output folder -i INPUT, --input INPUT Input path for single image, folder or text file (extension txt) containing paths -o OUTPUT_FOLDER, --output_folder OUTPUT_FOLDER Output path for raw image -s STAGE, --stage STAGE Stage name: 'binarization', 'ruler_detection', 'measurements' -ar, --auto_rotate Enable automatic rotation of input images based on EXIF tag -dpi DPI Dots per inch of the saved figures -csv PATH_CSV, --path_csv PATH_CSV Path of the resulting csv file --cache Enable computation cache (useful when developing algorithms)
